abstract: Hong Kong's Center for Food Safety finds low levels of radiation in powdered tea imported from Japan.
lead_paragraph: Other samples of Japanese food have occasionally been found to have low levels of radiation since the Fukushima disaster, the Hong Kong food center said.

headline.main: Hong Kong Finds Small Amount of Radioactivity in Sample of Japanese Tea
headline.print_headline: Hong Kong Finds Small Amount of Radioactivity in Sample of Japanese Tea

snippet: Other samples of Japanese food have occasionally been found to have low levels of radiation since the Fukushima disaster, the Hong Kong food center said.
